thank you very much for your helpful advices, these projects are useful and i would work on that and i will tell you the results.





Michael Stack <stack@...> wrote:                                  You might also take a look at how Heritrix is integrated into the 
 metacombine project: http://www.metacombine.org/.  Check under the 
 software tab.  Here is the original announcement: 
 http://groups.yahoo.com/group/archive-crawler/message/1905.
 
 Regards 2. in the below, do you want your additions to Heritrix to 
 include web UI?  Currently, the Heritrix UI Is not (easily) extensible 
 but it wouldn't be difficult making it so you could pass a list of 
 webapps, and the context on which to deploy the webapps, to the Heritrix 
 embedded Jetty webserver instance.  For example, if you bundled your 
 classifier UI up as the classifier.war file, you might browse to 
 http://localhost:8080/admin to get the Heritrix admin pages and to 
 http://localhost:8080/classifier to obtain your classifier UI.
 
 St.Ack
 
 sundaram subramanian wrote:
 >
 > My understanding is that you want to analyse the fetched pages and 
 > extract links based on that. I think you should write a new Extractor 
 > which calls your analyzer and extracts links based on it
 >
 > */ahmed ghouzia <ghouzia@...>/* wrote:
 >
 >     Dear Heritrix friends,
 >
 >     I am a researcher using heritrix to build a focused crawler  in my
 >     experimental work.
 >      I have a new crawling strategy which determines which pages to
 >     retrieve next so that it keeps your crawler focused on a psecific
 >     topic,
 >
 >     This strategy depends on examining the ststus of some features in
 >     the retrieved page, depending on this estimation , it would be
 >     determined which URL to get next.
 >
 >     I am asking the following:
 >
 >     1-Where to put this crawling strategy? As a frontier,  or a filter
 >     2- I want to display the results in a web page , like that
 >     displayed by search engines.
 >
 >     I would appreciate your help very much.
 >
 >     A.M. Ghozia
 >
 >
 >     ----------------------------------------------------------
 >     All-new Yahoo! Mail
 >     <http://us.rd.yahoo.com/evt=43256/*http://advision.webevents.yahoo.com/mailbeta>-
 >     Fire up a more powerful email and get things done faster.
 >
 >
 >
 >
 > Sundaram.S
 > C-131, VDSI, 9th floor,
 > Tidel,
 > Chennai
 >
 > - Thank God! you made life tough.. and me tougher!!
 >
 > ----------------------------------------------------------

 > <http://us.rd.yahoo.com/mail_us/taglines/postman7/*http://us.rd.yahoo.com/evt=39666/*http://messenger.yahoo.com>
